intro: Lasiorrhiza integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, smooth-edged leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Lasiorrhiza integrifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
